p: Descriptive statistics for mean yearly summertime SUHI intensity for the census tracts after grouping by prevalence are shown in Table 2. The mean SUHI intensity for White prevalent tracts is 1.46 K with Black and Hispanic prevalent tracts statistically significantly higher at 3.08 K and 3.15 K respectively. SUHI intensity in Asian prevalent tracts (2.73 K) was also higher than White prevalent tracts but is not statistically significant based on the Kolmogorov–Smirnov test. The maximums for all groups were within 1 K of each other but White has a lower minimum value than the alternative prevalent tracts.
